ch.bfh.ti.gravis.core.algorithm

Class BreadthFirstSearch

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.bfh.ti.gravis.core.algorithm.AbstractAlgorithm
      • ch.bfh.ti.gravis.core.algorithm.BreadthFirstSearch
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IAlgorithm

    public class BreadthFirstSearch
extends AbstractAlgorithm
    This class implements a non-recursive version of the breadth-first search (BFS) algorithm and uses a queue data structure. This implementation is based on pseudocode-description at:
    http://de.wikipedia.org/ wiki/Breitensuche
    If a reachable end vertex is selected, the algorithm shows the path from the start to the end vertex. If there is no reachable end vertex selected, all unreachable vertices and edges are marked in the graph.
    Author:
    Patrick Kofmel (kofmp1@bfh.ch)
